resources.string:
XVal decodes the "X" value from the Xbox 360® Dashboard and displays recorded security events.

Brought to you with love by cooltrainer.org.

Please direct your torrent of complaints to android@cooltrainer.org.

This application is free software. You can find its source at github.com/okeeblow/XVal

Both the console serial number and \'X\' value are displayed in the Dashboard. Go to Settings \u2192 Console Settings \u2192 System Info to see them. The serial number is also printed on the rear of the case and under the USB flap, but the value on the Dashboard is guaranteed to be correct if the case has been swapped.\n\nRemember, a clean rating in XVal doesn\'t guarantee a console is unbanned! A ban could be in place server-side without an infraction recorded in secdata.bin. If in doubt, perform an Xbox LIVE\u00AE connection test.
Serial number must be twelve numeric digits
\'X\' Value must be sixteen hexadecimal digits, dashes optional
Not a valid serial / XVal pair
